subject: Enable/disable default virtual keyboard
commitMessage:
Enable/disable default virtual keyboard

Since fullscreen shell does not support virtual keyboard,
added configure option to enable/disable default virtual
keyboard. This avoids unnecessary trial of launching vkb
and hence will improve boot time

Change-Id: I67bdd8ee231d101d6e3747a45968758af42ebc5a
Bug-Tizen: TC-810
Signed-off-by: Imran Zaman <imran.zaman@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

manuel can u please review the patch
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Please add a Bug-Tizen: ID to jira if possible

Patch Set 1:

Hi,

When happens in the normal case (without the patch), is that Weston tries to run the virtual keyboard several times, then fails gracefully. Fullscreen-shell is still usable after that (you can try it by adding "--shell=fullscreen-shell.so" to the command line).

What is the intended effect ? Just trying to understand the point here.

Patch Set 1:

In normal case, weston is never run with fullscreen shell.. 
Whenever it is run, it will fail 5 times and then will give up as fullscreen shell does not support virtual keyboard.
The point here is that in IVI we dont want weston to even try for virtual keyboard for fullscreen shell as it increases boot-time, and hence the patch
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Uploaded patch set 3.
Patch Set 3: Verified+1
Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated
Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Verified+1

Patch Set 4:

I think the usage of Bug-Tizen is now a bit misleading since this patch alone does not fix TC-810

Patch Set 4: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

OK, understood, it is about boot times.

The only other (and cleaner) way would be to check explicitly for "fullscreen-shell" and disable the VK in that case, but this seems problematic in design terms, and I'm pretty sure upstream does not care enough about boot times to merge such a workaround.

What's more, it is an IVI-only patch.

+2ed.

Patch Set 4:

Manuel, OK to merge?

Patch Set 4:

Hi Mikko,

Sorry that I +2ed before seeing your comment.

We just discussed it on IRC ; what about "Bug-Tizen: TC-XXX/related" ? Seems pretty good

I just suggest I merge this one like this, and we enforce this next time ?  What do you think ?

Patch Set 4:

@Mikko: ok for me !
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: shell: fix various interactions with the minimized state
commitMessage:
shell: fix various interactions with the minimized state

This fixes the following :
- if a surface was set fullscreen, and then minimized,
the fullscreen compositor state would stay on and display
a black screen ;
- if a surface was set fullscreen, and we would then
cycle between surfaces (with Mod+Tab e.g.), the fullscreen
compositor state would stay on, and the fullscreen layer
would sometimes hide surfaces positioned behind it ;
- style and functional polishing.

Change-Id: Ieeec480d16769f27d2ed7a97eb943e0100efcd0b
Bug-Tizen: TC-1349
Origin: http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/wayland-devel/2014-July/016257.html
Author: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>
Author: Nicolas Guyomard <nicolas.guyomard@open.eurogiciel.org>
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: shell: fix various interactions with the minimized state
commitMessage:
shell: fix various interactions with the minimized state

This fixes the following :
- if a surface was set fullscreen, and then minimized,
the fullscreen compositor state would stay on and display
a black screen ;
- if a surface was set fullscreen, and we would then
cycle between surfaces (with Mod+Tab e.g.), the fullscreen
compositor state would stay on, and the fullscreen layer
would sometimes hide surfaces positioned behind it ;
- style and functional polishing.

Bug-Tizen: TC-1349
Origin: http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/wayland-devel/2014-July/016257.html

Change-Id: Idef5539468b9719ffd5726c395f0e8cfa1cc4729
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: compositor-drm: Work around page flip not setting tiling mode on BYT
commitMessage:
compositor-drm: Work around page flip not setting tiling mode on BYT

The page flip ioctl() doesn't switch the tiling mode on BYT. That causes
cause display corruption when doing the renderer switch, since the dumb
buffer is untiled and the back buffers used by the GL renderer are use
X tiling.

Change-Id: Ib79358da9da3570a51483b3b237e300150f470fb
Signed-off-by: Ander Conselvan de Oliveira <conselvan2@gmail.com>
Tested-off-by: Quanxian Wang <quanxian.wang@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Hi Ossama and thanks for the comments,

I was supposed to comment on this before sending the patch, timeframe wasn't good, sorry for that.

What the first patch set did, was to add a requirement for "freerdp" ; currently this is packaged in Common only, so this could have broken IVI e.g..

So I just re-sent a patch set which now lets the original specfile unchanged, but adds an additional specfile ("weston-rdp.spec") which can be optionally enabled in the build system. This is safer and lets Weston unchanged on all profiles for now.

subject: shell: position input panel layer above fullscreen layer
commitMessage:
shell: position input panel layer above fullscreen layer

When a client calls the input panel (weston-keyboard e.g.)
and then goes fullscreen, the panel will not be hidden
anymore.

Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2228
Origin: http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/wayland-devel/2014-March/013523.html

Change-Id: Ia8bb924a824e1356c28b4bcaf34a7697be6e59c2
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: toytoolkit: totally switch to xdg-shell protocol
commitMessage:
toytoolkit: totally switch to xdg-shell protocol

Totally switch toytoolkit to xdg-shell instead of wl_shell,
so each state (maximization, minimization...) is correctly
handled.

subject: compositor: use Mod-Tab to show/raise minimized surfaces
commitMessage:
compositor: use Mod-Tab to show/raise minimized surfaces

Temporarily show minimized surfaces when switching between
surfaces with the keyboard. If the final selected one was
minimized, it will be restored.

subject: compositor: implement xdg_surface_set_minimized()
commitMessage:
compositor: implement xdg_surface_set_minimized()

We now handle the client-side xdg_surface_set_minimized()
call, and eventually hide the target surface by moving it
to a dedicated layer.

The tag submit/tizen_ivi_stable/20131116.101833 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit 113085e334e7182e3b551519a88b36fc9d186928 in tizen_ivi_stable branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in tizen_ivi_stable branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".

subject: Allow building in pure Wayland context
commitMessage:
Allow building in pure Wayland context

If X11 deps are not found, then libdrm headers are not
added to the global compile flags, and they won't be
found when compiling launcher-util.c for other backends
than x11 and drm (fbdev, wayland...). Fix the macro check.

Change-Id: I5b4e8af3c0082db986029ab919d200db7a34e6c7
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: v2:Fix [PTREL-522] Weston local build failed for X-Free repo.
commitMessage:
v2:Fix [PTREL-522] Weston local build failed for X-Free repo.

Changes from v1: use macro "extra_config_options" to reduce
duplication between the mobile and non-mobile.

drm-backend building will introduce dependency on libdrm, which make
fbdev-backend build failed. Since we only use fbdev-backend, for now,
in the Wayland Mobile profile, just disable drm-backend building
conditionally by using "with mobile" flag.

Use "with mobile" flag to conditionally disable drm-backend building.

Signed-off-by: Alex Wu <zhiwen.wu@linux.intel.com>

subject: build failure fix
commitMessage:
build failure fix

1. weston did not requires glu, as it is using gles to render
2. disable x11 and rpi backend, which is not necessary for both IVI and LITE

Change-Id: I51df68513da57d7a009d64c657ddf1c7a221a68e
Signed-off-by: Juan Zhao <juan.j.zhao@intel.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For issue 3, I think it is better to add "libdrm >= 2.4.30" into PKG_CHECK_MODULES() for FBDEV_COMPOSITOR and RPI_COMPOSITOR. 
Because, these two backends actually need launch-utils which need libdrm, rather than ENABLE_DRM_COMPOSITOR to be true.

Patch Set 1:

As you know, It's optional for rpi and fbdev backend...

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

ok, got it. +1 now.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Sorry Juan.  It's still not clear why this patch is necessary. I can understand wanting to remove the glu dependency, and disabling the x11-compositor.  However, src/Makefile.am doesn't appear to be needed, at least in the IVI build.  The weston package build just fine for me without the src/Makefile.am patch.  Is it needed in the mobile build?  If so, are you using the RPI and fbdev compositors?  If not, why don't you just disable them on the configure command line instead?

Furthermore, maintaining patch files to be applied during package build is frowned upon by our software architects since it defeats the purpose of using git/gerrit.

Patch Set 2:

Let me split the patch in to two. And we are using the fbdev backend, let me to think about how to find a better way to resolve this build failure in another patch.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

For that fbdev issue, I will send another patch, let's merge this alignment at first.

Patch Set 4: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: weston-launch: Don't exit on SIGTERM
commitMessage:
weston-launch: Don't exit on SIGTERM

Instead, forward signal to weston and wait for weston to clean up nicely.
Weston relies on weston-launch being around to shut down correctly,
so don't exit until we get the SIGCHLD from weston.  This make
killall weston-launch work properly.

https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=62910
